key_drivers: USD weakness (DXY 97.38, -0.44% day, -0.88% YTD) providing broad support across commodities and non-USD FX
BoJ hawkish trajectory (0.75%, hike to 1% expected by June 2026) driving 6J to STRONG_BULLISH
RBA surprise hike to 3.85% (Feb 3) widening AUD-USD differential, supporting 6A BULLISH
Oil supply tightening: 9.0M barrel draw (week ending Feb 13) + US-Iran geopolitical tensions supporting CL
Accelerating US growth (GDPNow 3.1% Q1 vs 2.3% Q4) is headwind for gold/bonds, capping GC/SI at SLIGHT_BULLISH

fed_stance.value: Neutral hold (96% no change at March 18-19 FOMC)

oil_supply_eia.value: Tightening: IEA supply plunge 1.2mb/d Jan; US-Iran tensions

geopolitical_risk.value: Rising: US-Iran tensions (oil +4% Feb 18), tariff risks

eur_usd_differential.value: Stable (ECB 2.00% vs Fed 3.50-3.75% - no change at either Feb meeting)

rba_stance.value: Hawkish hike +25bps to 3.85% (Feb 3, 2026 - first hike in 2+ years)

boj_stance.value: Hawkish/Tightening (0.75%, hike to 1% expected by June 2026)

jpy_usd_differential.value: Narrowing vs USD (BoJ hiking while Fed holds = bullish 6J)

china_growth.value: Mixed: NBS PMI 49.3 (contraction), Caixin PMI 50.3 (slight expansion)

risk_sentiment.value: Balanced (VIX 19.09 in 15-20 range, not risk-on or risk-off)

stale_sources: gold_etf_flows (January 2026 monthly data; February data not yet published)
fallbacks_used: CNBC US10YTIP for real yields (confirmed 1.794% UNCH vs FRED DFII10 1.79%)
CNBC 10Y2YS for yield curve (confirmed 0.60 UNCH vs FRED T10Y2Y 0.60%)
data_quality.data_as_of: 2026-02-22 Sunday session; all market data from Friday Feb 20 close
data_quality.notes: Weekend session (Feb 22 Sunday). EIA data from week ending Feb 13 released Feb 19 is most recent available. CNBC real-time data confirms FRED weekend readings are current. All major sources verified.
